Dialogue:
AH: Hello!
AQ: Hello.
AH: Do you like animals?
AQ: I like you.
AH: I see. By the way, do you have a favorite animal?
AQ: "I wonder if it's a dog."
AH: "Is it a small dog or a large dog?"
AQ: I like dachshunds.
AH: They’re small and adorable!
AQ: Yes, they are.
AH: "Are you keeping any pets?"
AQ: I don't have that as a pet.
AH: Taking care of pets can be pretty challenging, right?
AQ: Yes. Do you have a pet?
AH: I have a goldfish.
AQ: That’s cute.
AH: You've grown a lot!
AQ: "Is it the one you caught while goldfish scooping?"
AH: Yes, that’s the one.
AQ: That means you’re taking good care of it.
AH: It’s been with me for about four years now.
AQ: Impressive.
AH: Is that so?
AQ: Yes, because goldfish from scooping games are often weak.
AH: I’ve heard about that.
AQ: They usually don’t last long.
AH: Yes, one of mine died the day after I got it.
AQ: That happens often. I hope your goldfish stays healthy.
AH: I hope so too! Forever would be great.
AQ: Haha! Well, goodbye.

AH: Hello!
AQ: Hello.
AH: Do you eat breakfast?
AQ: Yes.
AH: What is your usual menu?
AQ: White rice with natto.
AH: Natto rice is simple and delicious.
AQ: Correct. Sometimes with raw eggs.
AH: That sounds like a great combination.
AQ: It is. Can you eat natto?
AH: Yes, every night.
AQ: Good for you.
AH: It's healthy too.
AQ: Yes, doctors recommend it.
AH: Even doctors?
AQ: Yes, mentioned on the news.
AH: I didn't know it was that beneficial.
AQ: It relates to lifespan.
AH: Fermented foods are good for you.
AQ: Correct.
AH: The first person to eat it was amazing.
AQ: True.
AH: If something is rotten, I throw it away.
AQ: Yes.
AH: The sauce is a great invention.
AQ: Noted.
AH: I love that sauce.
AQ: Understood.
AH: I didn't think others felt the same.
AQ: Noted.

AH: Good evening!
BI: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
AH: Have you had lunch?
BI: Yes, I had KFC.
AH: KFC is delicious.
BI: Yes, it is convenient.
AH: What did you have?
BI: A burger and fries.
AH: Does KFC offer burgers?
BI: Yes, there's a limited-time spicy one.
AH: Is it very spicy?
BI: It's mildly spicy but tasty.
AH: Spicy and delicious sounds appealing.
BI: Correct. I plan to have chicken for dinner.
AH: Sticking with KFC?
BI: Yes, I like trying different items.
AH: It's hard to choose because everything looks good.
BI: Indeed, I visit often.
AH: It's nice to eat out frequently.
BI: Convenience is important.
AH: If it's tasty, it's worth it.
BI: Have you decided on dinner?
AH: Not yet.
BI: What did you have last night?
AH: Mapo tofu.
BI: Was it spicy?
AH: I prefer it mildly spicy.
BI: I like it spicier.
AH: I'd like to try really spicy food someday.
BI: Enjoying the flavor is key.

AH: Good evening!  
BI: Good evening!  
AH: Which of the four seasons do you like?  
BI: I like autumn!  
AH: Autumn is great! You can enjoy various activities and delicious food.  
BI: That's correct. There are many delicious things in autumn!  
AH: What kind of autumn food do you like?  
BI: Speaking of autumn, it has to be Pacific saury!  
AH: It's a symbol of autumn!  
BI: Yes. I look forward to eating it every year.  
AH: Pacific saury is affordable and tasty.  
BI: Recently, the price has sometimes increased, which is disappointing.  
AH: Indeed, fish products have become more expensive lately.  
BI: It feels like autumn has become shorter, and everything feels strange.  
AH: Yes, it seems like the period of comfortable weather has shortened.  
BI: Yes, because it quickly goes from being very hot to very cold.  
AH: The temperature differences have become more drastic, haven't they?  
BI: I feel like the climate is changing rapidly.  
AH: Is it due to global warming?  
BI: The amount of snow has decreased, hasn't it?  
AH: Indeed, it doesn't snow at all in the Kanto region.  
BI: Even in the Tohoku region, it has decreased significantly compared to the past.  
AH: I had the impression that Tohoku was experiencing record snowfall.  
BI: In some parts, it might rain heavily.  
AH: It varies depending on the location.  
BI: The place where I used to live seems to have less snow now.  
AH: Is it better or worse now that it's more comfortable to spend time there?  
BI: I'm glad that shoveling snow has become easier!  
AH: That's good to hear!  
BI: Yes! Thank you very much.

AH: Good evening!  
AT: Good evening!  
AH: Have you already eaten dinner?  
AT: Yes, I had mapo tofu.  
AH: What a coincidence, I had that yesterday!  
AT: Interesting!  
AH: During summer, I often want spicy foods.  
AT: Spicy foods can make you sweat.  
AH: Yes, and it feels great to take a bath afterwards.  
AT: Understood. Do you enjoy spicy food?  
AH: I prefer mildly spicy food; too spicy is hard for me.  
AT: I feel the same, extremely spicy is difficult to handle.  
AH: Do you have any suggestions to alleviate the spiciness after eating something spicy?  
AT: Rolling cold drinks around on the tongue might help.  
AH: I've heard drinking water can be counterproductive. Any other tips?  
AT: I'll find more information for you.  
AH: That would be great, I'll look it up too!  
AT: What did you have for dinner today?  
AH: Stir-fried vegetables.  
AT: I used to eat that often too.  
AH: I frequently crave vegetables.  
AT: That's good; vegetables are very nutritious.  
AH: It's easy to miss out on vegetables in the diet.  
AT: How do you season them?  
AH: With oil, salt, and pepper.  
AT: Simple and delicious!  
AH: Yes, simple seasoning can be very tasty.  
AT: Let's make sure we consume plenty of nutrients this summer!

AH: Good evening!
AT: Good evening.
AH: Which season do you prefer?
AT: Summer.
AH: Summer has festivals and a fun atmosphere.
AT: Yes, and many outdoor events.
AH: It's enjoyable because it's hot.
AT: Ice cream is a highlight.
AH: Do you like ice cream?
AT: Do you?
AH: Yes, I love it.
AT: What type?
AH: Ice-based or refreshing.
AT: Polar bears, iceboxes, and sherbet.
AH: Garigari-kun too.
AT: Melts quickly outside.
AH: I eat it at home.
AT: Watermelon ice bar feels summery.
AH: Watermelon is a summer staple.
AT: Boxed ice cream for portion control.
AH: A box is great for eating a lot.
AT: Portion size is right.
AH: Eating too much can hurt your stomach.
AT: I have a sensitive stomach.
AH: We need to be cautious.
AT: Digestive medicine helps.
AH: Practical option.
AT: Gut health is tricky.
AH: Ice cream is hard to resist.
AT: Let's not overeat.

AH: Hello!  
AL: Hello!  
AH: Do you have a favorite season?  
AL: I dislike summer.  
AH: Summer is very hot.  
AL: Autumn is more pleasant.  
AH: Autumn is comfortable.  
AL: Travel and food are highlights of autumn.  
AH: It's easier to enjoy time in autumn than in summer.  
AL: Autumn is appreciated after summer.  
AH: Autumn feels shorter now.  
AL: Is summer longer?  
AH: Yes.  
AL: Do you prefer autumn?  
AH: Yes.  
AL: Autumn increases appetite.  
AH: I want to try different dishes in autumn.  
AL: Warm udon is good.  
AH: Good suggestion.  
AL: Anything else?  
AH: Saury is tasty in autumn.  
AL: Missed it last year.  
AH: What other foods?  
AL: Chestnuts.  
AH: Chestnuts too.  
AL: Limited edition autumn Haagen-Dazs is available.  
AH: Some items are available only in autumn.  
AL: Perhaps potatoes?  
AH: Baked sweet potatoes sound great.  
AL: Delicious.

AH: Hello!  
AL: Hello!  
AH: Do you like animals?  
AL: Yes, I like dogs.  
AH: Are they large or small dogs?  
AL: Both. I prefer blue-faced ones like French Bulldogs and Pugs.  
AH: They're cute, aren't they?  
AL: Yes, both French Bulldogs and Pugs are cute.  
AH: You seem knowledgeable about dogs.  
AL: I spent a lot of time looking at dog encyclopedias when I was a child.  
AH: There's such a thing as a dog encyclopedia?  
AL: Yes, and there are also cat encyclopedias. If you're interested in zoos, there are ones about giraffes too.  
AH: I liked giraffes when I was a kid.  
AL: They have surprisingly long tongues.  
AH: Really? I didn't notice because of their size.  
AL: There's a zoo called Sayuri World in Chiba.  
AH: Is it a big place?  
AL: It's small, but there are many giraffes there.  
AH: I see, I found many images of giraffes online.  
AL: You can feed the giraffes there.  
AH: What do they eat?  
AL: They eat carrots, but they seem to prefer bananas.  
AH: Bananas? That's interesting.  
AL: Probably because they're sweet. It's a zoo where you can feel small compared to the animals.  
AH: Giraffes have pretty cute faces too.  
AL: Yes, and they can be very persuasive when they want food.  
AH: With their size, I can imagine the pressure.  
AL: Yes, the children's excitement is evident.  
AH: It might be a bit overwhelming.  
AL: It can be.
